subject: JUnit Patch: Reducing duplication in all TestCases everywhere
msgSnippet: I just made a patch for JUnit to fix the long-standing annoyance of having to declare public MyTestCase(String name) { super(name); } at the top of every
messageBody:
I just made a patch for JUnit to fix the long-standing annoyance of
having to declare

public MyTestCase(String name)
{
super(name);
}

at the top of every single TestCase ever written. Talk about removing
duplication!

Download from http://www.purpletech.com/junit-patch/

My patched JUnit will happily instantiate a TestCase with no
constructor (that is, with the default no-arg constructor that the
compiler sticks in there automatically), and then call its setName()
method.

--
